website_summaries.verdict: Since they won't fit everyone equally well, the Polk UltraFit 3000 headphones will seem great to some users and not so great to others.
pros: The Polk UltraFit 3000 is a sports in-ear-canal model (with an around-the-ear bendable hook) that offers a sweatproof design, decent sound, and comes with a plethora of accessories, including multiple eartips and two swappable cords, including one that has an Apple-friendly remote with built-in microphone
cons: Not everybody will get a secure fit -- if you don't, bass response will be reduced and the earphones will sound thin

customer_reviews.title: Do not hold up well to sport use
customer_reviews.text: Plain and simple, after 5 months of regular sport use (i.e. running and biking) they failed on me. The line holding together the right earphone split open after about 3 months, and then the stiff wire inside started to rust. Over time they have become uncomfortable and lost sound quality in that ear. Overall aside from this flaw they were nice headphones. I've bought the bose in ears as well as a $100 pair of shure's, and the sound quality was comparable, but the bose and shure both lasted me a year and a half. Would not recommend to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: I wouldn’t recommend this product
customer_reviews.text: After a couple of months, it stopped working. I wouldn’t recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: CB

customer_reviews.title: Maybe Not "That" sweat prof
customer_reviews.text: I got these for jogging and bike commuting to work. They stay in place relatively well, but listening to Pandora thru my phone, the sound quality and fit is not drastically better than my $12 skull candy ear buds that I bought at Ross. After a few months of Texas heat and commuting. The sweat finally killed the headphones and they no longer work. They have been in the box on the floor for nearly a year, and I guess I'm about to find out if the warranty works or not.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Patrick Clingan

customer_reviews.title: Finally!  Sports headphones that work as promised!
customer_reviews.text: I have put the Polk Audio AutraFit 3000 thru their paces. Since they arrived, yesterday, I have gone running, biking, used the treadmill and elliptical while the headphones stayed in place and delivered a well balanced blend of treble and bass. I have owned hundreds of earphones in the last 30 years and this is the first brand/model that I could give a truly positive review.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck Ramsey

customer_reviews.title: Good sound and a secure fit
customer_reviews.text: Not a bad set of headphones. I've since retired this set of buds for a set of Audio Technica m70's (amazing). At the price point though, these were a bargain with better then average bass and overall quality.
customer_reviews.author: D. Shuey

customer_reviews.title: Good Sound Quility SUPER COMFORTABLE!!
customer_reviews.text: Once I got the right "ear gel" they fit like a dream with no hint of noise from the cable bouncing or the popping sound I normally get with this style ear phone! Great product at a pretty good price for the sound quality.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander A. White

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Sound but stay in/on your ear
customer_reviews.text: I wanted these to work sooo badly! I loved the over the ear design and coloring. The multitude of accessories that Polk provided was great. These definitely stay comfortably in your ear for as long as you like. I have to return them however because the sound is beyond frustrating. You put them in your ear and the bass is too loud. Naturally the earbuds work their way out of your ear somewhat and when they did, the bass was non-existant. So annoying! No matter what size bud covers I used, the sound was still the same. The search continues for good earbuds.
customer_reviews.author: Gorgeous

customer_reviews.title: Junk!
customer_reviews.text: I don't normally write a lot of reviews, but this product made me incredibly frustrated. I am an average runner that wanted a good set of headphones, I purchased these with prior knowledge of the company providing quality sound equipment. However, after running with them for less than 3 months, one headphone went dead. I attempted to contact the company on multiple occasions to see if they could rectify the issue and got no response. After multiple attempts, I simply went out and bought a set of Phillips, that were much cheaper and still work. I do not recommend these headphones for athletic use.
customer_reviews.author: Love Workours

customer_reviews.title: Ordered back in 2013 and they still work fine. Use them for walks and runs and they ...
customer_reviews.text: Ordered back in 2013 and they still work fine. Use them for walks and runs and they stay in my ear very well. Recommend to anyone who likes over the ear headphones. They fit well in my ear. Comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron M.

customer_reviews.title: Good sound but failded quickly
customer_reviews.text: These headphones sounded great for the three months that they operated correctly. Then I started getting shocked in my right ear...then the left ear. I emailed Polk about my problem and now I am waiting for their response. It amazes me that they broke that quickly, I used them about three to four times a week during workouts. Very disappointing from an otherwise quality company.
customer_reviews.author: Dan J. Reill

customer_reviews.title: Ultrafit 3000
customer_reviews.text: Sound is very good. Has many options for fit and comfort. Headphones are very good but not perfect. I had trouble maintaining a good seal in ears while running at times. Still working on different ear configurations for best fit.
customer_reviews.author: Taiter

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Sound
customer_reviews.text: I love these! They sound great and totally cut out noise around you - can be a good thing or bad... The cords are a bit thick and stiff but other than that they are a great buy!
customer_reviews.author: Agela Beach

customer_reviews.title: sound great, fit not
customer_reviews.text: The sound is really great. I can't get it to fit correctly in my left ear. I have tried all different combinations of the changeable bud end covers.
customer_reviews.author: Hector and Maria

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money.
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality is extremely poor for a Polk product. Have owned much cheaper(price wise) Aiwa and Philips earphones and this product is by far lesser quality. Used them a couple of times and stored them away. What a waste of money. I would not recommend this product to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Jose M.

customer_reviews.title: Wife Loves it
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my wife for Christmas. She finally told me the other day that she loves them. I was mainly worried about the comfort of them because there were the same style as what she had. However, she said they are very comfortable and wears them whenever she works out.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick

customer_reviews.title: They stay put
customer_reviews.text: really long rubber piece that extends into ear canal. It makes them a little uncomfortable. But they definitely stay put while running. I'd recommend them since normal ear buds were annoyingly popping out of my ear all the time.
customer_reviews.author: J. Cox

customer_reviews.title: The quality is great and they block out the noise perfectly
customer_reviews.text: These headphones actually stay put in place and I use them at the gym every day. The quality is great and they block out the noise perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Zhaneta M

customer_reviews.title: Don't bother.
customer_reviews.text: Junk! I prefer a pair of $20 Sony headphones for sound quality over these. Very disappointed in the sound quality.
customer_reviews.author: rick

customer_reviews.title: bad
customer_reviews.text: Don't know if I just got a bad pair, but the sound was really bad. Also they just did not fit my ears well, fell out almost as soon as I started running
customer_reviews.author: ANDY R

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Best ear phones ever! Bought an extra set for my son and husband.
customer_reviews.author: Lupe Bananas

customer_reviews.title: Ultra Fit as seen in GQ magazine
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these as a Christmas gift. Delivery was prompt and the price was much better than anywhere else I found them. My boyfriend raves about these headphones to everyone. He says they never slip or fall out of his ears. Even at the gym, they are no hassle and sound quality is excellent. He tells me all the time, "I don't know how much you paid, but it was money well spent"!
customer_reviews.author: Stritty

customer_reviews.title: Very good sound and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Polk Audio has done a nice job with these headphones. Very comfortable and great sound. Maybe not as good as my Bose noise canceling, but for workouts, they are perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Rod McKinney

customer_reviews.title: Great fit and stay in ears
customer_reviews.text: Use these all the time. Great fit and stay in ears.
customer_reviews.author: carlsbad4ever

customer_reviews.title: Not worht the money
customer_reviews.text: Not worth the money. Headphones wore out pretty quickly while wearing them during runs.
customer_reviews.author: MaLLoT

customer_reviews.title: Comfort, fit, sound
customer_reviews.text: All factors excellent. More noise canceling than I had anticipated, but not so much that all external sounds were blocked out.
customer_reviews.author: Alan

customer_reviews.title: Running headphones
customer_reviews.text: Great fit for a walk, but they slip a little on the run. Tried every possible ear-adapter, and still have a little slippage. Comfortable, and enjoy the volume bar feature.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Blados

customer_reviews.title: Defective
customer_reviews.text: Tried using the headphones for one race and the volume buttons stopped working one minute into run. The fit is great and the pause/play buttons work great -- but for $90 the volume buttons need to work for more than a minute. Going to return and give them one more shot...we will see.
customer_reviews.author: Linder17

customer_reviews.title: Are they supposed to do that?
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to run with, but the volume randomly adjusts, sometimes even going so far as to mute itself. They're the only headphones I have this issue with so I bought a different pair already.
customer_reviews.author: Autumn

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful sports headphones!
customer_reviews.text: After a lot of research, I bought these for use in the Gym or while on the trail! This works just fine and the sound quality is very crisp.
customer_reviews.author: Vijayan

customer_reviews.title: Not good
customer_reviews.text: The electronic controls buttons failed after only a couple of months use and then they just died. Not worth the money paid. They don't stay in your ear very well either.
customer_reviews.author: charles r rush II

customer_reviews.title: Classy and finally some bass!
customer_reviews.text: Been looking for proper headphones for running and working out as my old broke due to sweat. Tried a couple of different but there's just not enough bass in them. Decided to go for the expensive ones and tried Polk. OMG, what a difference! The sound is excellent and with all the different ear plugs that come with it you'll def find a perfect match. Two cables, perfect fit, noise reduction; I'm very happy with these! Just got them so if my mind changes through time I'll update this post.
customer_reviews.author: fred

customer_reviews.title: great fit, stay in place
customer_reviews.text: purchased as a gift for my g/f. She loves them, they stay in place, provide great sound and come with short and long cords. Def. recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: That's turrible.
customer_reviews.text: Great design, but the sound is absolutely horrific. Went for a run yesterday and there is no bass response AT ALL. Music sounded like it was coming out of a tin can. Maybe I got a defective pair? Who knows? Returning them immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Yougotkyle

customer_reviews.title: Worst product ever
customer_reviews.text: Headphones cable broke down after 2 days of easy use. Sound had like a short circuit. Not recommended at all
customer_reviews.author: Javier Cordero Torres

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable seating and bass. Not for active people.
customer_reviews.text: These are not good for working out, I constantly have to reseat them after doing a weight exercise and if you don't have them shoved all the way in your ear (Deep in your ear) there is no bass. I mistakenly bought these to replace the Polk earbud model that has the flange on the outside of of the earbud to hold it in place. Those models are much better for someone who moves around allot during a workout.
customer_reviews.author: L.Halby

customer_reviews.title: nice design but not durable
customer_reviews.text: The design for this product is nice. They fit well. After just two weeks of use they broke between the ear piece and the headband. They are definitely not made to last. The price was just not worth the lack of durability. They would be worth it if they were not so flimsy. I can't see them lasting for more than a few months. I will be looking for a durable pair....in fact it would be way worth it to pay a bit more for something that will last.
customer_reviews.author: Yvonne

customer_reviews.title: Decent Quality, Outstanding reliability
customer_reviews.text: Have had these for 16 month now. I run, hiked, and gymed in these. They bathed in my sweat enough times. Occasional pulls here and there. But they still work, with no visible signs of damage. I fully expect at least another full year from these EDIT: 16,5 month old and the left ear went out! Even though the wires don't have any tears
customer_reviews.author: Anna

product_meta.title: Polk Audio UltraFit 3000 Headphones - White/Orange
product_meta.description:
Product Packaging:Standard PackagingPolk Audio's new UltraFit Sports Headphone Series is a rethinking from the ground up of performance, comfort and durability - the three characteristics serious athletes need most in a pair of headphones. Serious music lovers too will value the UltraFit Series because of its undeniably impressive sonic performance. The UltraFit 3000 is an in-ear canal design that offers the highest sonic performance and the highest level of noise suppression. SecureFit support and a generous assortment of ear tip materials and sizes means you'll enjoy a snug yet comfortable in-ear canal fit. A 3 button remote control and in-line microphone enable you to use your iPod or iPhone anytime, anywhere. While an included short (14") cable means hassle-free and tangle free MP3 sleeve and collar connections.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER


Designed from the ground-up to meet the rigorous needs of the athlete and perfect for any active listener, UltraFit Sports headphones will be the last headphone you'll ever need to buy.

The UltraFit 3000 is an ultra-high performance in-ear canal design that offers a high level of noise suppression. SecureFit™ support and a generous assortment of ear tip materials and sizes means you'll enjoy a snug yet comfortable in-ear canal fit. A 3-button remote control and in-line microphone enable you to use your iPod® or iPhone® anytime, anywhere.

Three Cable Lengths For hassle-free, tangle-free Convenience. The UltraFit™ 3000 comes with three cable length options, so you can wear your music device the way that works best for you. A long (41") cable enables you to wear your music player on your waist or pants pocket. The short (14") cable is perfect if you wear your player on your arm, while the headphone to 1st connector is ideal for collar-clipped players like the iPod Shuffle®.

Key Features

 * High Performance Digital Sound—Exceptional detail, full fidelity and deep bass to maximize performance.
 * 3-Button Remote Control & Microphone—Use your iPhone® and iPod® on the fly with in-line controls.
 * SecureFit™ Support—Exercise or play knowing your headphones will stay comfortably in place.
 * Environmental Awareness Engineered In—Hear enough of your surroundings to feel secure during exercise.
 * Ultra Flexible Tangled-Free Planar Audio Cables—Avoid cable tangle and unwanted microphonics with oxygen-free cables in two custom lengths.
 * StrainGuard™—Kevlar core and computer designed transitional connections eliminate cable failure.
 * Moisture Shield—Resists moisture and keeps performing through strenuous activity.
 * Short (14") Cable—For iPod nano®, iPod
 * 3.5 mm Connector—Designed to fit through the opening on all cases.
 * Engineered For Durability & Comfort—Made with the latest materials and performance technology to take punishment while staying comfortable.

Why you should consider this product

 If you love to exercise or listen to music while on the go, Polk Audio UltraFit headphones are designed for you. UltraFit headphones deliver a richer, more natural sound that makes whatever you're doing more enjoyable. Their fit and comfort will practically make you forget you're even wearing them. UltraFit headphones were designed to stand up to professional athlete's demanding workouts, so you know they'll go the distance with you. It's one of the reasons the UltraFit Series will be the last headphone you ever need to buy. The UltraFit 3000 is an in-ear canal design that offers the highest sonic performance and the highest level of noise suppression. SecureFit™ support and a generous assortment of ear tip materials and sizes means you'll enjoy a snug yet comfortable in-ear canal fit. A 3-button remote control and in-line microphone enable you to use your iPod® or iPhone® anytime, anywhere. While an included short (14") cable means hassle-free and tangle-free MP3 sleeve and collar connections. 

Take a look inside this product

 1. Dynamic Balance® Polymer Drivers. UltraFit Sport Headphones employ dynamic drivers much like those in our full size speakers. To meet our pre-determined performance parameters, our engineers took the same care designing the drivers, even adding a discrete crossover filter to each driver to naturalize the high frequencies.
 2. Ported Enclosures. UltraFit Sports Headphones are ported. There is the port (ear piece) you put in your ear. But the big deal is the very small channels in the back of the driver enclosure, beneath the Polk logo. These are crucial to tuning the driver's frequency response peaks. And that means a better sounding pair of headphones.
 3. Ultra Flexible Tangle-free Planar Audio Cable. Round cables, coiling up and twisting are a constant source of annoyance because they get in the way of your workout. Eventually constant twisting means the cable will break or pull out at the end. The UltraFit's planar design (with oxygen-free wire for better conductivity) completely eliminates coiling, so the headphone cables won't tangle up during a workout, or when stored away. The planar design also eliminates micro-phonics, the tendency of an electronic device to turn a mechanical vibration into "noise," which you hear in other headphones. 
 4. Moisture Shield. No headphone works well in a sweat bath of moisture. So we added Moisture Shield, a filter that provides two benefits. Located in the ear port on the UltraFit 3000, the filter material resists moisture that could get to the driver; the headphones keep performing through strenuous activity. Moisture Shield also provides an acoustic barrier to help smooth frequency response.
 5. SecureFit™ Support. You're ready for your workout. You put on your headphones and get to work. The last thing you want is for an earpiece to fall out, instantly breaking your rhythm. SecureFit Support includes an ergonomically designed flexible ear hook that wraps around your ear, so the headphone stays in place, even during strenuous exercise. With SecureFit Support, you'll experience a snug yet comfortable fit.
 6. StrainGuard™. Sports headphones get a lot of abuse. UltraFit Sports Headphones have been designed with this in mind. Strainguard™ is a protective system that addresses the areas where sports headphones fail most often. A Kevlar core that houses the speaker wire provides extra tensile strength to prevent the wire from being pulled apart at common failure points - the transitions between cable and the connectors and at the headphones. In the UltraFit Series, all transitional connections are computer designed to strengthen the points where they fail most.
 7. Environmental Awareness. Being aware of your surroundings is always important when you use a pair of headphones. In the gym, on the track or walking through the neighborhood, you want to be able to have a sense of what's going on around you. The UltraFit 3000 provides a high level of noise reduction.

In the Box

 * Headphones
 * Protective Case
 * 14" Cable (35.6 cm)
 * 41" Cable (104.1 cm) with 3 Button 
 * Remote Control & Microphone 
 * 3 Pairs StayFit™ Silicone Ear Tips (S/M/L) 
 * 2 Pairs StayFit 3-Flange Silicone Ear Tips (S/L)
 * 2 Pairs Memory Foam Ear Tips (S/L) 
 * Nokia® Connection Adaptor 
 * Shirt Clip
 * Warranty: One Year Limited parts and labor

To setup and operate this product

Download the Quick Fit Guide

Download the Manual

Watch the Video

Technical Specifications

UltraFit 3000 Sensitivity 118db Impedance 16 ohms Aprox Weight 0.4oz (11gm) Frequency Response 8Hz-24Khz Style In Ear Canal Transducer Type Dynamic Balance® Transducer Diameter 6mm In Line Apple Remote Yes Built-in Microphone Yes Input Connections 3.5mm Finishes Black & Red, White & Orange Parts Warranty 1 Year Labor Warranty 1 Year Included Cables 13.4" Round, 14" Flat, 41" Flat Included Ear Pads Silicon Single Flange S/M/L, Silicon Triple Flange S/L, Memory Foam S/L Included Accessories Nokia® Adapter, Moisture Resistant Soft Case, Shirt Clip, Quick Start Guide and Manual 1To ensure a valid warranty, Polk loudspeakers must be purchased at an Authorized Polk Audio home or car loudspeaker Dealer such as Amazon.com. (If you're not sure a dealer is "authorized," call Polk Audio at 1-800-377-7655, and ask us.) The warranty is not transferrable, that means it applies only to the original purchaser. If you purchase your speakers from a private individual, that product is considered "used" and has NO factory warranty, no matter what the seller implies. The warranty is VOID if the serial number of the speaker has been removed or defaced. If you have any questions about your warranty coverage, or you think you need service, call Polk Customer Service at 1-800-377-7655. We're here to help you get the most from your new speakers!
feature_bullets: Ultra-High Performance Digital Sound - Stunning detail, full fidelity and deep bass to maximize performance
3 Button Remote Control & Microphone - Use your iPhone and iPod on the fly with in-line controls.
SecureFit Support - Exercise or play knowing your headphones will stay comfortably in place.
Ultra Flexible Tangled-Free Planar Audio Cables - Avoid cable tangle and unwanted microphonics with oxygen-free cables in two custom lengths.
StrainGuard - Kevlar core and computer designed transitional connections eliminate cable failure

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.0 out of 5 stars55 ratings3.0 out of 5 stars
